issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
When the app is backgrounded and is then pulled back into the foreground, we need to refresh data. Should at the very least refresh the catalog, categories, and orders. However, I think we should use the storage service to mark the timestamp of when the app was backgrounded and only do the refresh after some length of time has elapsed. Say, 2 minutes? If I was switching between my text app (or whatever) and the norwex app frequently, I wouldn't want to wait for the app to refresh my data every single time. 

If the app has been backgrounded for a really long period of time, we may want to call window.reload or something?

It wouldn't surprise me if we have some navigation issues upon returning to the foreground, especially if the app was backgrounded for a while. I'm not sure how the app will behave in that scenario, but we may need to find a way to get users back to the catalog page in case they get orphaned on the checkout page or something. Maybe we can wrap the ion-back-button and test if there's no view stack, and navigate-root to the catalog? This may not even be an issue... Just trying to get out in front of one.

I'm open to ideas and suggestions here!
fields.summary: Need to refresh data after returning to the foreground

comments.body:
[~eric.fontenault], [~andrew.butler], should we also add refreshing the user data when the app returns to the foreground incase they changed something on the web? 

If so, can we wrap all this same logic into app startup to refresh the user from Nova?
tested v0.4.19 passed

fields.description:
Steps:
 1. in US create an account and log in
 2. set default address and payment in profile
 3. add items to cart
 4. checkout and apply the defaults to the order
 5. leave the order open
 6. sign out
 
*At this point the order items are still in the cart, even though user is now a visitor
 
 7.change location to CA
 8. goto shopping from side menu
 
**At this point items are still in the cart
 
 9. got cart
 10. checkout
 11. click no for party and cons
 12. submit order
 
***Order succeeds, with all previous US customer data
fields.summary: US order data persists after customer signs out and as a visitor changes location to CA

comments.body:
I can confirm the issue with the order persisting after signing out. In my experience, killing the app and restarting it brought up the app with no temp order as expected. I think this is a scenario where we need to call changeDetectorRef.detectChanges(). 

Fixing this could render the 2nd half of this ticket irrelevant.
tested v0.4.19 passed

I completed order with new consultant. Went to buy again and created another order. Clicked on Edit consultant. This time I should see two consultants and only saw the original brandye. *This IS a bug.*
Same bug if i go to my profile
 
If i close the app and then restart it I get two consultants like I should.
Make sure Customer Consultants update after submitting an order

{code:java}
address1: "800 bethel rd"
address2: ""

state: "tx"

messages: []
code: null
href: null

address1: "800 W Bethel Rd"
address2: null
address3: null
city: "Coppell"
state: "TX"
postal_code: "75019-4422"
country_code: "US"

catalog: {id: 1499, updated_date_time: "2020-04-07T13:57:41-0500", end_date_time: "2021-04-01T12:00:00-0500"}
id: 1499
updated_date_time: "2020-04-07T13:57:41-0500"
end_date_time: "2021-04-01T12:00:00-0500"
{code}
We should have the alert suggest the new address and let the user decide which to use.

fields.description:
Order items can become invalid after they are added to the cart. Nova does not validate these order items until the cart is submitted. If there are invalid items, nova send us back an error message for each sku. These messages are listed vertically on a page with options to update or remove each item. There is also a "Fix All" button which will remove any invalid items that can't be fixed, and updating the rest.

An example of an invalid item that can't be fixed is a sku that is now out of stock, or not available in the current catalog (but was available in the previous catalog when the order was created).

An example of an invalid item that can be fixed is a sku whose price has changed.
fields.summary: Fix up invalid item popup
Modify Party Routes

fields.description:
Results from testing 4/2 with Noua:

Very annoying TestFlight in the middle of everything! (Need a new link?)

1) Go to [http://nwx-demo-app-installs.s3-website-us-east-1.amazonaws.com/?url=http://ashleypeeples.norwex.biz/en_US/customer/party/4224130] (it may take a second to load)

2) Click "Open App"

3) Get through test flight

4) Should see a popup with party details and a "Join Party" button

5) Joining the party sets the party id of the order (icon in toolbar) and default consultant to the consultant of the party.

 

Issues:

(A) User was signed in. Never got the popup

(B) Reset the app, opened the link, app opened with the popup! Joined the party. Signed in. The party was still there, but the user's consultant was their previous consultant, not the consultant of the party. :(

QA user: [me@betaemail.com|mailto:me@betaemail.com] pass: password123

fields.description:
On the order page, when you save the shipping or payment method the section reformats to an intermediate look with a set as default button, then reformats to the final look. The intermediate state needs to be removed because on old phones with slow response you see a button and try to click it, then it goes away to the final look. If you are on a fast phone it just flashes the screen while it redraws it twice.

Can we remove the intermediate formatting?

fields.description:
On shopping app 04.11 on QA, add 1517 to the cart.

There is a Spend and Get customer incentive that says if the cart contains 1517, offer 1150 for only $5. That works perfectly and adds 1150 to the cart.

But if 1517 is then removed from the cart, 1150 should also be removed. The order submit failed, but there is no indication why other than a failure and call support.

I then removed 1150 and submitted the order successfully.

Jeremy knows how this works on MAX when a required product is removed from the cart.

issuetype.name: Story

fields.description:
update 4/6 EF - 
 Consultant can be changed in the profile settings and on the checkout page
 My Consultants” can only be seen on the ConsultantLocator which is only accessible from those 2 locations
  


 UPDATE 2/6-EF: We currently have a search for consultant form, but the Customer also has an array of consultants that they have been connected with in the past (or just have ordered with in the past?). I'm updating the scope of this ticket to add a way for a customer to change their consultant from somewhere on the About page (the one that displays the consultant information).

 _______________________________________________________________

 

lexus needs the ability to execute a search using a contact id and return a list of consultants with whom the consultant has a contact with the same email address.

This will primarily be used when ordering if the Customer says they do not have a consultant but when we search we find that she does have one or more consultants.

The purpose is for her to select one of the consultants or reject all of them (in which case she will be assigned one from another group of qualified consultants.)
fields.summary: lexus search for my consultants needed

comments.body: No longer blocked!!

Easiest way I can think of to test this is to create a brand new consultant from the side menu. Go into the profile settings and click change on "Your Consultant" to view the Consultant Locator. There should be no pre-populated consultants in the search results. Submit an order, then go back to the Consultant Locator in profile settings. The consultant that was assigned to your previous order should be pre-populated here. Search for another consultant and place an order with her. Go back to the Consultant Locator and you should see both consultants.

Consultants will only appear in this pre-populated section if you place an order with them.

I checked on [norwex.biz|http://norwex.biz/] and they prevent viewing the item details (nav forward). The only option is to delete the item. We're going to prevent nav forward.

status.name: Done - Passed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
Expected funtionality:

Visitors
- no menu -> profile edit
- email field on order is shown and editable on initial entry and future entries (unless next point)
- creating an account transitions the experience to Customer
Customer
- menu -> profile edit -> email is shown, autopopulated, and disabled
- email field on order is shown, autopopulated, and disabled from edit
So if a visitor creates an account through the checkout process, what they enter is fixed in that email form field from then on
If they create an account through the login/side menu, the email there is used for the show-auto-disable customer experience


When registering a new account email from within the order process, do not allow the email to be changed from within the order process by making the email field read only if the email address exists.

-The only place that an customer email address should be changed is from the menu profile change section.-

Rob

 

 

-If a visitor enters their email, saves the contact, then edits it to something else, the account is created with the first email regardless of edits. We should move the account registration to the submission process in order to not create an account under the wrong email. By consequence, the "save as defaults" still need to be triggered to show, but cannot be saved until the submission as well.-

 -- 

-Yeah, discuss this one with the team, it's a pretty violent ticket.-
fields.summary: Visitors Should Create their Account in Checkout with the "Final" Email

comments.body: Yeah, that's true. Pretty violent. It would disrupt the entire flow, logging in, claiming an order, etc. It'd make the actual submission a very lengthy process and spinner

I don't think we need to move account registration process anywhere else now that we have the inline/quick login bit working. But we do need to disable the email field on this form for both the checkout and profile pages so that the email can't be changed until we have an endpoint that lets us update the username for a customer account.

I highly recommend this ticket be altered. Once an email account is entered on an order, it should not be able to be changed except through the profile account section from the menu; NOT within the order process. PLEASE do not move account creation to submit.
tested v0.4.15 passed

fields.summary: Review Catalog Image loading

comments.body: Confirmed that this is still an issue even with the image caching solution. Images can take some time to load initially, i think we need to set a manual height on the images at the bare minimum to avoid the constant resizing, and we may want to consider expanding the smartimg directive to add a spinner on the image container or displaying the default img and transitioning to the new image once loaded.

status.name: Done - Passed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
The plan should be:

1) identify error messages for which a customer might to an action. Then have them displayed with translations. There probably should be a mapping between different payment provider messages and our Norwex user defined error messages.

2) the payment provider error code (not message) should be tagged on to the end of every payment gateway error message. This would allow the customer to report the message and the code. The message could be as simple as "There was an error on this payment. You may need to try a different payment method. C43056".

If we provide the "code" at the end of the message we enable the code to be reported to CCC by the customer, we should be able to identify the payment provide ('C' for Chase Payment Gateway) and the specific code 43056 which will not mean anything to the customer or CCC, but will be meaningful to development.

Rob

 

 

+Test Evidence+

As a customer, tester was confused by the error message (SQL error passed back to user, not intuitive)

As a CCC personnel, noted that there was not enough information a user could call in with to explain the issue. Need to add/clarify info and provide CCC testing (“Is there a tracking system I should be using?”). Perhaps talk to NOVA about error clarification.

The checkout process was unclear. Added profile, party, and consultant (no for both), and clicked submit. The alert said something about payments which did not make sense to her.

+To Do+

Talk to NOVA team and see if we can get back more meaningful answers/error types. The error report should give a little more guidance to the user as to the next steps (Joseph recommended having the CCC number, I'd add that we should tag it with the call feature).
fields.summary: Improve Error Reporting on Order Submission

comments.body:
Possible error:
```
type: "PaymentGatewayException"
messages: ["Merchant Override Decline"]
code: 0
href: null
```

From Slack: 
 400 - Request validation failed
 401 - Not authorized
 500 - PaymentGatewayException
 500 - ConsultantLeadNotFoundException
 500 - AccountReserveOrderSubmitProcedureException
 400 - OrderSubmissionValidationFailedException
  
 Those are exceptions we raise on purpose. Whatever else goes wrong and was unhandled would be returned as a 500 as well
Also from Slack: most are going to be translated, anything coming back from third party vendors probably won't be.
Easy way to test? Put 1150 into your cart and checkout.

comments.body: If you click on the "dusting mitt green" product to view the product details, you'll notice that there aren't any images at all. I think what's happening is that the recycled list item view is retaining the image from its previous catalog item since the current catalog item has no new information. we might have a null check that's preventing us from 'un-setting' and image url.
These SKUs are now filtered out b/c the are `is_visibile_in_ui=false` and have no commodity class. I think we can invalidate this ticket. [~eric.fontenault]
[~edward.ramos] can you verify that this is resolved? It should be fixed in the latest QA version (v0.4.16)
